definition: worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: It is likely, however, that the Magi were familiar with the great Messianic prophesies .
sentences.chinese: 这是有可能，但是，贤士熟悉伟大救世主的预言。

sentences.english: These are the three wise men.
Girdle of the Warrior Magi now has a socket bonus .
sentences.chinese: 腰带的战士贤士现在有一个插座的奖金。

sentences.english: They asked the talents to serve the society.
sentences.chinese: 然后再要求这些贤士出来为社会服务。

sentences.english: The Magi reached Bethlehem because they had obediently allowed themselves to be guided by the star.
sentences.chinese: 贤士们来到了白冷，因为他们顺从异星的指引。

definition: great person of the past/venerable forebear/the great and the good
famous scholar/worthy/celebrity, esp. distinguished literary person having no official post
Lord Menchang of Qi, Chancellor of Qi and of Wei during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
high-ranking officials in the court of a Chinese emperor
Su Qin (340-284 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
